docs.snippet: The Committee of Inquiry relative to sanitary affairs in our Army, have returned from their four of inspection in and around Washington, and the sessions of the Commission are now field in this City.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Committee of Inquiry relative to sanitary affairs in our Army, have returned from their four of inspection in and around Washington, and the sessions of the Commission are now field in this City.

docs.snippet: It is not known whether Gen. SCOTT intends to take the field in person. Some think he will; but it is probable that his age and feeble health may interpose barriers to an active participation in the fight. At any rate he will receive the glory of...

headline.main: Will Gen. Scott Lead the Army-- Gen. McClellan-- A Chance for Speculation.

docs.lead_paragraph: It is not known whether Gen. SCOTT intends to take the field in person. Some think he will; but it is probable that his age and feeble health may interpose barriers to an active participation in the fight. At any rate he will receive the glory of having planned the campaign, when success... crowns it, and his laurels will not be sullied by his remaining quietly at Washington.

headline.main: NOTES OF THE REBELLION.; AFFAIRS AT FORTRESS MONROE. NO FORWARD MOVEMENT AT PRESENT CONDITION OF THE SURROUNDING COUNTRY DEPARTURE OF MASSACHUSETTS MEN SPEECH OF GEN. BUTLER.

docs.lead_paragraph: I returned to my post early yesterday morning. The health of our troops continues good. Gen. BUTLER is still waiting to be effectively reinforced with cavalry and artillery, before making any forward movement. Lieut. BUTLER, of the staffs has obtained a number of horses. The quality of those thus far seen in Washington and vicinity is superior.
